dcterms:description: A variant of GAN dynamics that captures learning a mixture of two univariate Gaussians, often failing to converge due to mode collapse or oscillatory behavior.
dcterms:title: GMM-GAN

dcterms:creator: L. Metz
B. Poole
D. Pfau
J. Sohl-Dickstein
dcterms:description: A method that improves GAN training by unrolling multiple discriminator gradient steps in the generator loss function.
dcterms:title: Unrolled GANs

dcterms:description: A theoretical model involving a mixture of two univariate Gaussians, discussed in the context of GAN dynamics.
dcterms:title: Mixture of Two Univariate Gaussians

dcterms:description: A mathematical concept used to measure the difference between probability distributions, particularly in the context of GANs.
dcterms:title: Total Variation Distance
